result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander S Kolenda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Inform agent of all prescriptions. Sign releases for agent.

Case 15CF0492 was dismissed and read in. No Contact with any residences or co-actors listed in the criminal complaint. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. STAYED for use of agent with court's permission.

records.addlTxt: Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
Court minutes from 07/16/15 plea/sentencing have been corrected to indicate that Count #2 of Amended Information was dismissed and read-in. Corrected JOC to be prepared.
Dated 08/13/15, from Atty Flynn, requesting correction of JOC.

Defendant Alexander S Kolenda in court with attorney Jennifer Flynn.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended information filed. Reading is waived. Defendant enters guilty plea to count # 1 of Amended Information. Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of count#1 of Amended Information. Count #2 of Amended Information as well as Case #15CF492 is dismissed and read in to this case.

The Defendant was given the following:

COUNT 1

WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol, illegal drugs, or drug paraphernalia.
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions, sign releases.
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with:residence or co-actors listed in the criminal complaint.
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $250 DNA surcharge + $278.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME: 60 days-Non-working hours with standard release conditions, STAYED, for use of agent with court permission. 

Felony Warnings, Voting Rights and Firearms Warnings provided to defendant
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 16, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Dated 05/28/15, from Atty Flynn to Judge Carter, with attached information for plea/sentencing hearing.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 29, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Alexander S Kolenda in court with Attorney Jennifer Flynn.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Flynn requests a plea and sentence date.  Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
